unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace in Maharashtra; Aims for Enhanced Grid Efficiency**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace in Maharashtra; Aims for Enhanced Grid Efficiency**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) is accelerating its smart meter installation program across the state, targeting widespread adoption by 2025. As of 10/11/2024, over 5 lakh smart meters have been deployed in urban centres like Pune and Nagpur, enabling real-time energy consumption monitoring and reducing Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses.
normalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (M S E D C L) is accelerating its smart meter installation program across the state, targeting widespread adoption by two thousand and twenty five. As of tenth november two thousand and twenty four, over five lakh smart meters have been deployed in urban centres like Pune and Nagpur, enabling real-time energy consumption monitoring and reducing Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses.

unnormalised: The initiative, funded in part by a Rs. 5000 crore central government grant, aims to improve billing accuracy and empower consumers with greater control over their electricity usage. MSEDCL expects to install an additional 20 lakh meters by 31/12/2024.
normalised: The initiative, funded in part by a rupee five thousand crore central government grant, aims to improve billing accuracy and empower consumers with greater control over their electricity usage. M S E D C L expects to install an additional twenty lakh meters by thirty first december two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: "This is a game-changer for the energy sector," stated Shri. Patil, Chairman of MSEDCL during a press conference at 11:00 hrs on 15/08/2024. He added that the project, inspired by global best practices and tailored for the Indian context, will contribute significantly to achieving net-zero emissions targets. Data security concerns have been addressed through robust encryption and adherence to national data protection standards, ensuring the privacy of consumer information. Benefits are expected to reflect in consumer bills within 6 months of installation.
normalised: "This is a game-changer for the energy sector," stated Shri. Patil, Chairman of M S E D C L during a press conference at eleven hundred hours on fifteenth august two thousand and twenty four. He added that the project, inspired by global best practices and tailored for the Indian context, will contribute significantly to achieving net-zero emissions targets. Data security concerns have been addressed through robust encryption and adherence to national data protection standards, ensuring the privacy of consumer information. Benefits are expected to reflect in consumer bills within six months of installation.
